content.question: A car is driven on a straight road, and the distance traveled by the car after time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by a quadratic function <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="s of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>s</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in feet and <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in seconds for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Of the following, which gives the best estimate of the velocity of the car, in feet per second, at time <math alttext="t equals 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator s of 6, and denominator 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>s</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator s of 8, minus, s of 4, and denominator 8 minus 4, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>s</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>s</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator s of 7, minus, s of 5, and denominator 7 minus 5, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>s</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>s</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator s of 7, minus, s of 5, and denominator 7 minus 5, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>s</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>s</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 1.1: Introducing Calculus - Can Change Occur at an Instant?

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
